FuncDef:
The threshold command configures the threshold that determines when the pre-paid service sends the application for quotas.
The undo threshold cancels the configuration.
By default, the threshold is 0 for either time or volume.
CLIs: threshold { time <time-threshold> seconds | volume <volume-threshold> { kbytes | mbytes | bytes } }
undo threshold { time [ <time-threshold> seconds ] | volume [ <volume-threshold> { kbytes | mbytes | bytes } ] }

ParaDef.Info:
Use a certain period of time as the threshold.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295.

Configure the unit to be second.
-

Use a certain quantity of volume as the threshold.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295. The default value is 0.

Configure the unit to be Kbyte.
-

Configure the unit to be Mbyte.
-

Configure the unit to be Byte.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command can avoid the quotas from leaking out since a service still possesses the quotas during the time it is sending the application for more quotas to the server. With this command, the service can deliever the application for time or traffic quotas beforehand.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
